item.title: Thursday’s big stock stories: What’s likely to move the market in the next trading session
item.description: The S&P 500 eked out a narrow gain on Wednesday. The NYSE is closed on Thursday in honor of late former President Jimmy Carter. Here's what's on CNBC'...

item.title: Shares of California utility Edison International drop 10% as wildfires rage
item.description: The decline comes as multiple large fires are burning around Los Angeles, with strong winds making them difficult to contain.

item.title: Bank of America sees an opportunity to grab solid yields using these assets
item.description: Despite a sell-off in December, preferred stock saw favorable returns last year.

item.title: First major stock benchmark nears correction as small-cap Russell 2000 trade unravels
item.description: The Russell 2000 is experiencing a weak start to the year.

item.title: Quantum stocks like Rigetti plunge after Nvidia's Huang says the computers are 15 to 30 years away
item.description: Quantum computing stocks dropped Wednesday after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang declared that useful quantum computers are likely decades in the future.
